description.narrative: 1. Identify and evaluate patients’ needs and research and development gaps, through scoping, exploratory evaluation, feasibility assessment for support and integration of potential new diseases for DNDi. 2. Mature ideas co-developed with partners into new projects and services. 3. Implement support models, ranging from “light” approaches (such as knowledge-sharing or helping with an advocacy “push”) to more “active” approaches (such as building new resource platforms or serving as an “incubator” for an idea that may ultimately be externalised or hosted within DNDi).

The Dynamic Portfolio Unit (DPU) is a transversal and multi-dimensional evaluation and decision-making process to allow for rapid and efficient DNDi response to emerging patient needs. The evaluation process for each new opportunity is managed as a project with a transversal project team across all relevant regional offices with leadership from DP Unit to drive the technical, scientific, and access workstreams. The Dynamic Portofolio approach is instrumental for focusing on the most neglected diseases and increasing DNDi’s impact.
